Name: Name
The name of the OpenSearch service: The name of the OpenSearch service
The description of the OpenSearch servic: The description of the OpenSearch service
The volume size for each node: The volume size for each node
Number of nodes for the cluster to creat: Number of nodes for the cluster to create
The discovery.zen.no_master_block settin: The discovery.zen.no_master_block settings controls what operations should be rejected when there is no active master.
If the expected number of nodes is not a: If the expected number of nodes is not achieved, the recovery process waits for the configured amount of time before trying to recover regardless. Defaults to 5m if one of the expected_nodes settings is configured.
Enable or disable cross-origin resource: Enable or disable cross-origin resource sharing, i.e. whether a browser on another origin can execute requests against Elasticsearch.
Controls the memory size for the filter: Controls the memory size for the filter cache , defaults to 10%. Accepts either a percentage value, like 5%, or an exact value, like 512mb.
Accepts either a percentage or a byte si: Accepts either a percentage or a byte size value. It defaults to 10%, meaning that 10% of the total heap allocated to a node will be used as the indexing buffer size shared across all shards.
The shard-level request cache module cac: The shard-level request cache module caches the local results on each shard. The cache is managed at the node level, and has a default maximum size of 1% of the heap.
Specify whether scripts with inline type: Specify whether scripts with inline type are allowed.
Specify whether scripts with stored type: Specify whether scripts with stored type are allowed.
Specify whether scripts with file type a: Specify whether scripts with file type are allowed.
Specify whether scripts can be executed: Specify whether scripts can be executed in aggregations context.
Specify whether scripts can be executed in search context.
Specify whether scripts can be executed in update context.
When you run logstash, you use the -f to: When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in input section
When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in filter section
When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in output section
When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in output elasticsearch section
Specify the location of extensional dict: Specify the location of extensional dictionary from remote.
Specify the location of extensional stop: Specify the location of extensional stopwords dictionary from remote.
This config is used to adding content in: This config is used to adding content into Gemfile for logstash
The ip of one of logstash node used to c: The ip of one of logstash node used to collect logs on OpenSearch.
In order to enable allowing to delete in: In order to enable allowing to delete indices via wildcards or _all, set this config to false.
The max size of the field data cache.
Specify the location of shared file syst: Specify the location of shared file system repository.
Specify the location of read-only URL re: Specify the location of read-only URL repository.
Sets the maximum allowed size of the cli: Sets the maximum allowed size of the client request body in nginx.
Whether to enable heap dump on out of me: Whether to enable heap dump on out of memory error.
Clean logs older than n days, n can be c: Clean logs older than n days, n can be changed here.
Log in OpenSearch with the default usern: Log in OpenSearch with the default username for admin. Modification is not supported after creation.
Log in OpenSearch with the default passw: Log in OpenSearch with the default password admin. Modification is not supported after creation.

err_code122: Failed to count remaining docs on nodes
err_code123: The selected nodes still hold data
